name: market for baling | baling | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8820/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'baling', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;This is delivering the service of 'baling', for 1 round bale of silage (mass of 700 kg and 1.4 m3) without loading it onto a trailer. The bales is wrapped with PE film which is covered within this service. The service does not include transportation of the bales to the farm. A user wishing to model this service and is aware that within his/her model there is a production of 1400 kg of silage while in this service assumes a bale of 700 kg, there the user can model 2 bales of this service for their model.

This activity starts with the service generation.


This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0163:Post-harvest crop activities
